medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Insomnia developed 2 weeks before presentation, with associated symptoms of seeing white 'granular balls' on skin and crawling sensations. Over the last 10 days before presentation, she reported increasing anxiety and insomnia after running out of clonazepam. Symptoms peaked just before the emergency visit.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, major depression (now in remission), acne, drug dependency, diverticulitis, nephrolithiasis, and a perforated duodenal ulcer requiring surgical repair.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal aunt had schizophrenia, mother attempted suicide during the patient's childhood.
medical_history.social_history: Unemployed for 2 years, living with her son, receiving transitional food assistance, previously injected oxycodone but reported no opioid use since the birth of her child, denied alcohol consumption, reported occasional use of illicit amphetamines.
